trial_identification.studytitle: The Fluid Translation of Research into Practice Study (Fluid-TRIPS): An International Cross-Sectional Survey of Fluid Resuscitation Practice in Intensive Care Unit Patients
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Translating reliable evidence on fluid resuscitation of intensive care patients into clinical practice Improving patient outcomes and containing public health costs

conditions.healthcondition: fluid resuscitation in intensive care unit

interventions.interventions: An international cross-sectional survey will be undertaken which audits fluid resuscitation practice in participating ICUs on a single day.

primaryOutcome.outcome: To describe the amount and type of resuscitation fluid currently administered to adult patients in intensive care units (ICU) in different countries
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Data will be collected over a designated 24-hour study day

secondaryOutcome.outcome: To describe and compare the costs of fluid choice between different geographical regions
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Data will be collected over a designated 24-hour study day

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Adult patients present in the ICU at the 10am census at the start of on the study day or admitted during the 24-hour study period will be included in the study sample.

sponsorship.primarysponsorname: The George Institute for global health
sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: Level 13 321 Kent Street Sydney NSW 2000 Australia

fundingsource.fundingname: The George Institute for global health; Critical Care & Trauma Division
fundingsource.fundingaddress: Level 13 321 Kent Street Sydney NSW 2000 Australia

othercollaborator.othercollaboratoraddress:
The George Institute for Global Health Critical Care and Trauma Division
Level 13 321 Kent Street Sydney NSW 2000

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The objective of this project is to describe international trends in the prescription of intravenous fluids for fluid resuscitation in intensive care and to determine the major drivers of choice.

ethicscommitee.ethicname: Sydney Local Health District Ethics Review Committee (RPAH Zone)
ethicscommitee.ethicaddress: Research Development Office Suite 210A RPAH Medical Centre 100 Carillon Avenue NEWTOWN NSW 2042
